author: Anthony Harrup
title: Mexico’s Televisa Gets a Start Selling Non-Core Assets
text:
MEXICO CITY—Mexican broadcast and media company Grupo Televisa SAB said Friday it has agreed to sell its stake in Spain’s Imagina Media Audiovisual, kicking off a plan to divest noncore assets and concentrate on bolstering its content and pay TV businesses.
Televisa expects to receive 284 million euros ($354 million) from the sale of its 19% stake in Europe-focused Imagina, which markets rights to sporting events including the Spanish soccer league, and produces television content and films. The stake is part of the 53.5%...
